definition: to lend/to put out a loan

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
to lend/to borrow/by means of/to take (an opportunity)

sentences.english: Second, the participation of non-owner occupied, such as housing loan or rental.
sentences.chinese: 二是讓非所有人佔有，如將房屋出借或出租。

sentences.english: On the supply side, tight lending remains the norm.
sentences.chinese: 在提供方面，嚴緊的出借仍然是標準”。

sentences.english: We also have everything available on cassette.
sentences.chinese: 我們也有盒式錄音帶出借。

sentences.english: Nearly all the 71 pieces on show are loans.
sentences.chinese: 展出的71件作品幾乎都是出借品。

sentences.english: Many hospitals for go see a doctor to the patient and family provide the convenience, all free loans the wheelchair.
sentences.chinese: 許多醫院爲給病家就醫提供便利，都免費出借輪椅車。

sentences.english: The two also lend out shares used by others to short.
sentences.chinese: 兩家公司還出借股票給其他作空方使用。

sentences.english: Unfortunately, stealing books people continuously failed to surrender lending.
sentences.chinese: 遺憾的是，偷書人不斷未能自首出借書籍。

sentences.english: Don't lend or borrow money or belongings.
sentences.chinese: 不要出借或是求借錢或財物。

sentences.english: They had no reading books to lend.
sentences.chinese: 他們沒有閱讀用書可以出借。

definition: to provide (an asset) as security for a loan/to put up collateral
to lend (sth other than money)/to borrow
to borrow or lend money/debit and credit items on a balance sheet
borrower/leaser/the hiring side of a contract
